title: 108_hr3767
content: The Act titled "Medicare Prescription Drug Savings and Choice Act of 2004" establishes a Medicare operated prescription drug plan option under the Social Security Act. The Act establishes a Medicare operated prescription drug plan option with nationwide coverage. The Secretary will negotiate with pharmaceutical manufacturers to reduce drug costs for eligible individuals. Strategies will be implemented to promote the use of more affordable alternatives. The Medicare operated prescription drug plan aims to reduce purchase costs by implementing strategies similar to other Federal purchasers. The plan offers qualified prescription drug coverage with access to negotiated prices, and a uniform monthly beneficiary premium nationally. The Medicare operated prescription drug plan determines premiums based on average monthly costs, including administrative expenses. The Secretary can adjust premiums for plans offering supplemental coverage. At least one plan in 2006 must have a $35 monthly premium. The Medicare operated prescription drug plan is offered nationally and in addition to other qualifying plans. The plan can be designated as a fallback plan for certain service areas. The Medicare operated prescription drug plan can be designated as a fallback plan for specific service areas, as determined appropriate by the Secretary. Amendments include adding "and medicare operated prescription drug plans" in section headings and allowing for payments related to the operation of medicare operated prescription drug plans. The amendments made by this section relate to payments for expenses incurred with respect to the operation of Medicare operated prescription drug plans under section 1860D-11A. The effective date of these amendments is retroactive to the enactment of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003.
